Endoscopists are at high risk from inhalation of airborne droplets, mucosal contact, and potential fecal-oral transmission. The European Society of Gastrointestinal Endoscopy and the European Society of Gastroenterology and Endoscopy Nurses Associated (ESGE/ESGENA) produced a detailed position statement for the COVID-19 pandemic, listing urgent (nondeferrable) and nonurgent (requiring a case-by-case evaluation) procedures. Patients risk stratification of being infected by SARS-CoV-2 is needed for scheduled GI endoscopy activities: in cases of high risk or confirmed infection, adequate PPE is required.
68 Reprocessing of flexible endoscopes and accessories should be performed according to published guidelines, with use of viricidal agents recommended.
